info.title: Theme
info.description:
A theme controls the look and feel of a Shopify online store.

{{ '/api/reference/theme.png' | image }}

A store can have a maximum of 20 themes, one of which is the published theme that customers see when they visit the online store. Customers can't see unpublished themes. When you publish a theme, the previously published theme becomes unpublished.

To modify theme files after they're uploaded, use the Asset resource. To learn how to create your own theme, refer to Building themes

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Show only certain fields, specified by a comma-separated list of field names.

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/themes.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::Theme.all(
  session: test_session,
)

paths.description:
Creates a theme by providing the public URL of a ZIP file that contains the theme.

A new theme is always unpublished by default. To publish a theme when you create it, include "role": "main" in the POST request. The theme will be published only after all of its files have been extracted and stored by Shopify, which might take a couple of minutes.

x-examples.name: Create a theme that has a custom name and is published

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"theme":{"name":"Lemongrass","src":"http://themes.shopify.com/theme.zip","role":"main"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/themes.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

theme = ShopifyAPI::Theme.new(session: test_session)
theme.name = "Lemongrass"
theme.src = "http://themes.shopify.com/theme.zip"
theme.role = "main"
theme.save()

x-examples.name: Creating a theme without a name fails and returns an error

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"theme":{"body":"foobar"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/themes.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

theme = ShopifyAPI::Theme.new(session: test_session)
theme.body = "foobar"
theme.save()

paths.description: Retrieves a single theme by its ID.
paths.summary: Retrieves a single theme by its ID

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Show only certain fields, specified by a comma-separated list of field names.

200.description: Retrieves a single theme by its ID

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/themes/828155753.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::Theme.find(
  session: test_session,
  id: 828155753,
)

curl -d '{"theme":{"id":752253240,"name":"Experimental"}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/themes/752253240.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

theme = ShopifyAPI::Theme.new(session: test_session)
theme.id = 752253240
theme.name = "Experimental"
theme.save()

curl -d '{"theme":{"id":752253240,"role":"main"}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/themes/752253240.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

theme = ShopifyAPI::Theme.new(session: test_session)
theme.id = 752253240
theme.role = "main"
theme.save()

paths.description: Deletes a theme. A theme can't be deleted while it's uploading, updating, or if the theme is the last published theme.

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X DELETE "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/themes/752253240.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::Theme.delete(
  session: test_session,
  id: 752253240,
)

properties.description: The date and time when the theme was created. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)
properties.name: created_at

properties.description: The unique numeric identifier for the theme.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Whether the theme can currently be previewed.
properties.name: previewable

properties.description: Whether files are still being copied into place for this theme.
properties.name: processing

properties.description:
Specifies how the theme is being used within the shop. Valid values:
  • main: The theme is published. Customers see it when they visit the online store.
  • unpublished: The theme is unpublished. Customers can't see it.
  • demo: The theme is installed on the store as a demo. The theme can't be published until the merchant buys the full version.
  • development: The theme is used for development. The theme can't be published, and is temporary.
properties.name: role

properties.description: A unique identifier applied to Shopify-made themes that are installed from the Shopify Theme Store Theme Store. Not all themes available in the Theme Store are developed by Shopify. Returns null if the store's theme isn't made by Shopify, or if it wasn't installed from the Theme Store.
properties.name: theme_store_id

properties.description: The date and time of when the theme was last updated. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)
properties.name: updated_at

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Manage a store's themes, which control the look and feel of an online store. Use the Asset API to update specific files within a theme.
